page.title: 16USES OF THE RIVER
page.content: This is the result of an interview with Mr. Emerson, a Hydrographic Surveyor,who works for the Manchester Ship Canal Company. This Company, together with the North West Water Authority, are responsible for the River Mersey in our area. There are two main functions of the Mersey today and for the future - 1.As a major drain for Warrington, 2.As a recreational facility for the area. In this area the River is tidal and, in springtime, the tides push the level up higher than Howley Weir - up to one foot of water is 'backed up' river as far as Woolston Weir. Only good water management prevents any threat of flooding.
